INNER JOIN `yearmonth` AS `T2`

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
chosen:
SELECT
  CAST((
    SUM(
      CASE
        WHEN `T1`.`Segment` = 'SME' AND `T2`.`Date` LIKE '2013%'
        THEN `T2`.`Consumption`
        ELSE 0
      END
    ) - SUM(
      CASE
        WHEN `T1`.`Segment` = 'SME' AND `T2`.`Date` LIKE '2012%'
        THEN `T2`.`Consumption`
        ELSE 0
      END
    )
  ) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / SUM(
    CASE
      WHEN `T1`.`Segment` = 'SME' AND `T2`.`Date` LIKE '2012%'
      THEN `T2`.`Consumption`
      ELSE 0
    END
  ),
  CAST(SUM(
    CASE
      WHEN `T1`.`Segment` = 'LAM' AND `T2`.`Date` LIKE '2013%'
      THEN `T2`.`Consumption`
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) - SUM(
    CASE
      WHEN `T1`.`Segment` = 'LAM' AND `T2`.`Date` LIKE '2012%'
      THEN `T2`.`Consumption`
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / SUM(
    CASE
      WHEN `T1`.`Segment` = 'LAM' AND `T2`.`Date` LIKE '2012%'
      THEN `T2`.`Consumption`
      ELSE 0
    END
  ),
  CAST(SUM(
    CASE
      WHEN `T1`.`Segment` = 'KAM' AND `T2`.`Date` LIKE '2013%'
      THEN `T2`.`Consumption`
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) - SUM(
    CASE
      WHEN `T1`.`Segment` = 'KAM' AND `T2`.`Date` LIKE '2012%'
      THEN `T2`.`Consumption`
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / SUM(
    CASE
      WHEN `T1`.`Segment` = 'KAM' AND `T2`.`Date` LIKE '2012%'
      THEN `T2`.`Consumption`
      ELSE 0
    END
  )
FROM `customers` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `yearmonth` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`CustomerID` = `T2`.`CustomerID`

  SUM(CASE WHEN SUBSTR(`T2`.`Date`, 1, 4) = '2013' THEN `T2`.`Consumption` ELSE 0 END) / SUM(CASE WHEN SUBSTR(`T2`.`Date`, 1, 4) = '2012' THEN `T2`.`Consumption` ELSE 0 END) AS `IncreaseRate`
FROM `customers` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `yearmonth` AS `T2`

  `event_name` TEXT COMMENT 'event name',
  `event_date` TEXT COMMENT 'The date the event took place or is scheduled to take place; e.g. 2020-03-10T12:00:00',
  `type` TEXT COMMENT 'The kind of event, such as game, social, election',
  `notes` TEXT COMMENT 'A free text field for any notes about the event',
  `location` TEXT COMMENT 'Address where the event was held or is to be held or the name of such a location',
  `status` TEXT COMMENT 'One of three values indicating if the event is in planning, is opened, or is closed; Open/ Closed/ Planning'
);
CREATE TABLE `Expense` (
  `expense_id` TEXT COMMENT 'unique id of income',
  `expense_description` TEXT COMMENT 'A textual description of what the money was spend for',

  `cost` DOUBLE COMMENT 'The dollar amount of the expense; the unit is dollar',

  `link_to_member` TEXT COMMENT 'The member who incurred the expense',
  `link_to_budget` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the record in the Budget table that indicates the expected total expenditure for a given category and event.; References the Budget table'
);
CREATE TABLE `Income` (
  `income_id` TEXT COMMENT 'A unique identifier for each record of income',
  `date_received` TEXT COMMENT 'the date that the fund received',
  `amount` BIGINT COMMENT 'amount of funds; the unit is dollar',
  `source` TEXT COMMENT 'A value indicating where the funds come from such as dues, or the annual university allocation',
  `notes` TEXT COMMENT 'A free-text value giving any needed details about the receipt of funds',
  `link_to_member` TEXT COMMENT 'link to member'
);

  `major_id` TEXT COMMENT 'A unique identifier for each major',

);

  `last_name` TEXT COMMENT 'members last name; commonsense evidence:

  `email` TEXT COMMENT 'members email',
  `position` TEXT COMMENT 'The position the member holds in the club',
  `t_shirt_size` TEXT COMMENT 'The size of tee shirt that member wants when shirts are ordered; commonsense evidence: usually the student ordered t-shirt with lager size has bigger body shape',
  `phone` TEXT COMMENT 'The best telephone at which to contact the member',
  `zip` BIGINT COMMENT 'the zip code of the members hometown',
  `link_to_major` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the major of the member. References the Major table'
);
CREATE TABLE `Zip_Code` (
  `zip_code` BIGINT COMMENT 'The ZIP code itself. A five-digit number identifying a US post office.',

� Standard: the normal codes with which most people are familiar 
� PO Box: zip codes have post office boxes 
� Unique: zip codes that are assigned to individual organizations.',

  `short_state` TEXT COMMENT 'The abbreviation of the state to which the ZIP pertains'
);

  `T2`.`amount`
FROM `member` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `income` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`member_id` = `T2`.`link_to_member`
WHERE
  `T1`.`position` = 'Vice President'

FROM `member` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `expense` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`member_id` = `T2`.`link_to_member`
WHERE
  `T1`.`last_name` = 'Allen'
  AND `T1`.`first_name` = 'Elijah'

  )

  ON `T1`.`member_id` = `T2`.`link_to_member`
INNER JOIN `expense` AS `T3`
  ON `T2`.`link_to_event` = `T3`.`link_to_event`
WHERE
  `T1`.`first_name` = 'Elijah' AND `T1`.`last_name` = 'Allen' AND SUBSTR(`T3`.`expense_date`, 6, 2) IN ('09', '10')

  SUM(CASE WHEN SUBSTR(`T1`.`event_date`, 1, 4) = '2019' THEN `T2`.`spent` ELSE 0 END) - SUM(CASE WHEN SUBSTR(`T1`.`event_date`, 1, 4) = '2020' THEN `T2`.`spent` ELSE 0 END) AS `num`
FROM `event` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `budget` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`event_id` = `T2`.`link_to_event`

FROM `budget`
JOIN `event`
  ON `event`.`event_id` = `budget`.`link_to_event`

);

  `status` TEXT COMMENT 'One of three values indicating if the event is in planning, is opened, or is closed; Open/ Closed/ Planning'

  `link_to_budget` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the record in the Budget table that indicates the expected total expenditure for a given category and event.; References the Budget table'
);

SELECT
  CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN `T2`.`event_name` = 'Yearly Kickoff' THEN `T1`.`amount` ELSE 0 END) AS DOUBLE) / SUM(CASE WHEN `T2`.`event_name` = 'October Meeting' THEN `T1`.`amount` ELSE 0 END)
FROM `budget` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `event` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`link_to_event` = `T2`.`event_id`
WHERE
  `T1`.`category` = 'Advertisement' AND `T2`.`type` = 'Meeting'

FROM `budget` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `event` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`link_to_event` = `T2`.`event_id`
WHERE
  `T2`.`event_name` = 'Yearly Kickoff' AND `T1`.`category` = 'Advertisement'
  AND `T1`.`amount` > (
    SELECT
      `amount`
    FROM `budget` AS `T3`
    INNER JOIN `event` AS `T4`
      ON `T3`.`link_to_event` = `T4`.`event_id`
    WHERE
      `T4`.`event_name` = 'October Meeting' AND `T3`.`category` = 'Advertisement'
  )

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:
Based on the total cost for all event, what is the percentage of cost for Yearly Kickoff event?
CREATE TABLE `Attendance` (
  `link_to_event` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the event which was attended; References the Event table',
  `link_to_member` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the member who attended the event; References the Member table'
);
CREATE TABLE `Budget` (
  `budget_id` TEXT COMMENT 'A unique identifier for the budget entry',
  `category` TEXT COMMENT 'The area for which the amount is budgeted, such as, advertisement, food, parking',
  `spent` DOUBLE COMMENT 'The total amount spent in the budgeted category for an event.; the unit is dollar. This is summarized from the Expense table',
  `remaining` DOUBLE COMMENT 'A value calculated as the amount budgeted minus the amount spent; the unit is dollar 
commonsense evidence: If the remaining < 0, it means that the cost has exceeded the budget.',
  `amount` BIGINT COMMENT 'The amount budgeted for the specified category and event; the unit is dollar 
commonsense evidence:
some computation like: amount = spent + remaining',
  `event_status` TEXT COMMENT 'the status of the event; Closed / Open/ Planning 
commonsense evidence: 
 Closed: It means that the event is closed. The spent and the remaining wont change anymore.
 Open: It means that the event is already opened. The spent and the remaining will change with new expenses.
 Planning: The event is not started yet but is planning. The spent and the remaining wont change at this stage.',
  `link_to_event` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the event to which the budget line applies.; References the Event table'
);
CREATE TABLE `Event` (
  `event_id` TEXT COMMENT 'A unique identifier for the event',
  `event_name` TEXT COMMENT 'event name',
  `event_date` TEXT COMMENT 'The date the event took place or is scheduled to take place; e.g. 2020-03-10T12:00:00',
  `type` TEXT COMMENT 'The kind of event, such as game, social, election',
  `notes` TEXT COMMENT 'A free text field for any notes about the event',
  `location` TEXT COMMENT 'Address where the event was held or is to be held or the name of such a location',
  `status` TEXT COMMENT 'One of three values indicating if the event is in planning, is opened, or is closed; Open/ Closed/ Planning'
);
CREATE TABLE `Expense` (
  `expense_id` TEXT COMMENT 'unique id of income',
  `expense_description` TEXT COMMENT 'A textual description of what the money was spend for',
  `expense_date` TEXT COMMENT 'The date the expense was incurred; e.g. YYYY-MM-DD',
  `cost` DOUBLE COMMENT 'The dollar amount of the expense; the unit is dollar',
  `approved` TEXT COMMENT 'A true or false value indicating if the expense was approved; true/ false',
  `link_to_member` TEXT COMMENT 'The member who incurred the expense',
  `link_to_budget` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the record in the Budget table that indicates the expected total expenditure for a given category and event.; References the Budget table'
);
CREATE TABLE `Income` (
  `income_id` TEXT COMMENT 'A unique identifier for each record of income',
  `date_received` TEXT COMMENT 'the date that the fund received',
  `amount` BIGINT COMMENT 'amount of funds; the unit is dollar',
  `source` TEXT COMMENT 'A value indicating where the funds come from such as dues, or the annual university allocation',
  `notes` TEXT COMMENT 'A free-text value giving any needed details about the receipt of funds',
  `link_to_member` TEXT COMMENT 'link to member'
);
CREATE TABLE `Major` (
  `major_id` TEXT COMMENT 'A unique identifier for each major',
  `major_name` TEXT COMMENT 'major name',
  `department` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the department that offers the major',
  `college` TEXT COMMENT 'The name college that houses the department that offers the major'
);
CREATE TABLE `Member` (
  `member_id` TEXT COMMENT 'unique id of member',
  `first_name` TEXT COMMENT 'members first name',
  `last_name` TEXT COMMENT 'members last name; commonsense evidence: 
full name is first_name + last_name. e.g. A members first name is Angela and last name is Sanders. Thus, his/her full name is Angela Sanders.',
  `email` TEXT COMMENT 'members email',
  `position` TEXT COMMENT 'The position the member holds in the club',
  `t_shirt_size` TEXT COMMENT 'The size of tee shirt that member wants when shirts are ordered; commonsense evidence: usually the student ordered t-shirt with lager size has bigger body shape',
  `phone` TEXT COMMENT 'The best telephone at which to contact the member',
  `zip` BIGINT COMMENT 'the zip code of the members hometown',
  `link_to_major` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the major of the member. References the Major table'
);
CREATE TABLE `Zip_Code` (
  `zip_code` BIGINT COMMENT 'The ZIP code itself. A five-digit number identifying a US post office.',
  `type` TEXT COMMENT 'The kind of ZIP code; commonsense evidence: 
� Standard: the normal codes with which most people are familiar 
� PO Box: zip codes have post office boxes 
� Unique: zip codes that are assigned to individual organizations.',
  `city` TEXT COMMENT 'The city to which the ZIP pertains',
  `county` TEXT COMMENT 'The county to which the ZIP pertains',
  `state` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the state to which the ZIP pertains',
  `short_state` TEXT COMMENT 'The abbreviation of the state to which the ZIP pertains'
);

SELECT
  CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN `T1`.`event_name` = 'Yearly Kickoff' THEN `T3`.`cost` ELSE 0 END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / SUM(`T3`.`cost`)
FROM `event` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `budget` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`event_id` = `T2`.`link_to_event`
INNER JOIN `expense` AS `T3`
  ON `T2`.`budget_id` = `T3`.`link_to_budget`

INNER JOIN `expense` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`event_id` = `T2`.`link_to_event`

  `link_to_member` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the member who attended the event; References the Member table'
);
CREATE TABLE `Budget` (
  `budget_id` TEXT COMMENT 'A unique identifier for the budget entry',
  `category` TEXT COMMENT 'The area for which the amount is budgeted, such as, advertisement, food, parking',
  `spent` DOUBLE COMMENT 'The total amount spent in the budgeted category for an event.; the unit is dollar. This is summarized from the Expense table',
  `remaining` DOUBLE COMMENT 'A value calculated as the amount budgeted minus the amount spent; the unit is dollar 
commonsense evidence: If the remaining < 0, it means that the cost has exceeded the budget.',
  `amount` BIGINT COMMENT 'The amount budgeted for the specified category and event; the unit is dollar 
commonsense evidence:
some computation like: amount = spent + remaining',
  `event_status` TEXT COMMENT 'the status of the event; Closed / Open/ Planning 
commonsense evidence: 
 Closed: It means that the event is closed. The spent and the remaining wont change anymore.
 Open: It means that the event is already opened. The spent and the remaining will change with new expenses.
 Planning: The event is not started yet but is planning. The spent and the remaining wont change at this stage.',
  `link_to_event` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the event to which the budget line applies.; References the Event table'
);
CREATE TABLE `Event` (
  `event_id` TEXT COMMENT 'A unique identifier for the event',
  `event_name` TEXT COMMENT 'event name',
  `event_date` TEXT COMMENT 'The date the event took place or is scheduled to take place; e.g. 2020-03-10T12:00:00',
  `type` TEXT COMMENT 'The kind of event, such as game, social, election',
  `notes` TEXT COMMENT 'A free text field for any notes about the event',
  `location` TEXT COMMENT 'Address where the event was held or is to be held or the name of such a location',
  `status` TEXT COMMENT 'One of three values indicating if the event is in planning, is opened, or is closed; Open/ Closed/ Planning'
);
CREATE TABLE `Expense` (
  `expense_id` TEXT COMMENT 'unique id of income',
  `expense_description` TEXT COMMENT 'A textual description of what the money was spend for',
  `expense_date` TEXT COMMENT 'The date the expense was incurred; e.g. YYYY-MM-DD',
  `cost` DOUBLE COMMENT 'The dollar amount of the expense; the unit is dollar',
  `approved` TEXT COMMENT 'A true or false value indicating if the expense was approved; true/ false',
  `link_to_member` TEXT COMMENT 'The member who incurred the expense',
  `link_to_budget` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the record in the Budget table that indicates the expected total expenditure for a given category and event.; References the Budget table'
);
CREATE TABLE `Income` (
  `income_id` TEXT COMMENT 'A unique identifier for each record of income',
  `date_received` TEXT COMMENT 'the date that the fund received',
  `amount` BIGINT COMMENT 'amount of funds; the unit is dollar',
  `source` TEXT COMMENT 'A value indicating where the funds come from such as dues, or the annual university allocation',
  `notes` TEXT COMMENT 'A free-text value giving any needed details about the receipt of funds',
  `link_to_member` TEXT COMMENT 'link to member'
);
CREATE TABLE `Major` (
  `major_id` TEXT COMMENT 'A unique identifier for each major',
  `major_name` TEXT COMMENT 'major name',
  `department` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the department that offers the major',
  `college` TEXT COMMENT 'The name college that houses the department that offers the major'
);
CREATE TABLE `Member` (
  `member_id` TEXT COMMENT 'unique id of member',
  `first_name` TEXT COMMENT 'members first name',
  `last_name` TEXT COMMENT 'members last name; commonsense evidence: 
full name is first_name + last_name. e.g. A members first name is Angela and last name is Sanders. Thus, his/her full name is Angela Sanders.',
  `email` TEXT COMMENT 'members email',
  `position` TEXT COMMENT 'The position the member holds in the club',
  `t_shirt_size` TEXT COMMENT 'The size of tee shirt that member wants when shirts are ordered; commonsense evidence: usually the student ordered t-shirt with lager size has bigger body shape',
  `phone` TEXT COMMENT 'The best telephone at which to contact the member',
  `zip` BIGINT COMMENT 'the zip code of the members hometown',
  `link_to_major` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the major of the member. References the Major table'
);
CREATE TABLE `Zip_Code` (
  `zip_code` BIGINT COMMENT 'The ZIP code itself. A five-digit number identifying a US post office.',
  `type` TEXT COMMENT 'The kind of ZIP code; commonsense evidence: 
� Standard: the normal codes with which most people are familiar 
� PO Box: zip codes have post office boxes 
� Unique: zip codes that are assigned to individual organizations.',
  `city` TEXT COMMENT 'The city to which the ZIP pertains',
  `county` TEXT COMMENT 'The county to which the ZIP pertains',
  `state` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the state to which the ZIP pertains',
  `short_state` TEXT COMMENT 'The abbreviation of the state to which the ZIP pertains'
);
chosen:
SELECT DISTINCT
  `T2`.`category`,
  `T1`.`type`
FROM `event` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `budget` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`event_id` = `T2`.`link_to_event`
WHERE
  `T1`.`location` = 'MU 215' AND `T2`.`spent` = 0 AND `T1`.`type` = 'Guest Speaker'
rejected:
SELECT DISTINCT
  `T2`.`category`
FROM `event` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `budget` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`event_id` = `T2`.`link_to_event`
WHERE
  `T1`.`location` = 'MU 215' AND `T2`.`spent` = 0

SELECT

FROM `member` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `income` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`member_id` = `T2`.`link_to_member`
WHERE
  `T1`.`position` = 'Member' AND `T1`.`t_shirt_size` = 'Medium'
rejected:

FROM `member` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `income` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`member_id` = `T2`.`link_to_member`
WHERE
  `T1`.`t_shirt_size` = 'Medium'

  ON `T1`.`link_to_budget` = `T2`.`budget_id`
INNER JOIN `member` AS `T3`

  `T1`.`cost` > (
    SELECT
      AVG(`T1`.`cost`)

    SELECT

    FROM `expense`

  `major_id` TEXT COMMENT 'A unique identifier for each major',
  `major_name` TEXT COMMENT 'major name',
  `department` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the department that offers the major',
  `college` TEXT COMMENT 'The name college that houses the department that offers the major'
);
CREATE TABLE `Member` (
  `member_id` TEXT COMMENT 'unique id of member',
  `first_name` TEXT COMMENT 'members first name',
  `last_name` TEXT COMMENT 'members last name; commonsense evidence: 
full name is first_name + last_name. e.g. A members first name is Angela and last name is Sanders. Thus, his/her full name is Angela Sanders.',
  `email` TEXT COMMENT 'members email',
  `position` TEXT COMMENT 'The position the member holds in the club',
  `t_shirt_size` TEXT COMMENT 'The size of tee shirt that member wants when shirts are ordered; commonsense evidence: usually the student ordered t-shirt with lager size has bigger body shape',
  `phone` TEXT COMMENT 'The best telephone at which to contact the member',
  `zip` BIGINT COMMENT 'the zip code of the members hometown',

);

FROM `expense` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `member` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`link_to_member` = `T2`.`member_id`
WHERE
  `T1`.`expense_description` = 'Water, Veggie tray, supplies'

INNER JOIN `budget` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`budget_id` = `T3`.`link_to_budget`
WHERE
  `T2`.`category` = 'Water, Veggie Tray and Supplies'

instruction: You are an expert data analyst. Please write a MySQL query that satisfies the requirement below.
input:
Write the full names of students who received funds on the date of 9/9/2019 and include the amount received.
CREATE TABLE `Attendance` (
  `link_to_event` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the event which was attended; References the Event table',
  `link_to_member` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the member who attended the event; References the Member table'
);
CREATE TABLE `Budget` (
  `budget_id` TEXT COMMENT 'A unique identifier for the budget entry',
  `category` TEXT COMMENT 'The area for which the amount is budgeted, such as, advertisement, food, parking',
  `spent` DOUBLE COMMENT 'The total amount spent in the budgeted category for an event.; the unit is dollar. This is summarized from the Expense table',
  `remaining` DOUBLE COMMENT 'A value calculated as the amount budgeted minus the amount spent; the unit is dollar 
commonsense evidence: If the remaining < 0, it means that the cost has exceeded the budget.',
  `amount` BIGINT COMMENT 'The amount budgeted for the specified category and event; the unit is dollar 
commonsense evidence:
some computation like: amount = spent + remaining',
  `event_status` TEXT COMMENT 'the status of the event; Closed / Open/ Planning 
commonsense evidence: 
 Closed: It means that the event is closed. The spent and the remaining wont change anymore.
 Open: It means that the event is already opened. The spent and the remaining will change with new expenses.
 Planning: The event is not started yet but is planning. The spent and the remaining wont change at this stage.',
  `link_to_event` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the event to which the budget line applies.; References the Event table'
);
CREATE TABLE `Event` (
  `event_id` TEXT COMMENT 'A unique identifier for the event',
  `event_name` TEXT COMMENT 'event name',
  `event_date` TEXT COMMENT 'The date the event took place or is scheduled to take place; e.g. 2020-03-10T12:00:00',
  `type` TEXT COMMENT 'The kind of event, such as game, social, election',
  `notes` TEXT COMMENT 'A free text field for any notes about the event',
  `location` TEXT COMMENT 'Address where the event was held or is to be held or the name of such a location',
  `status` TEXT COMMENT 'One of three values indicating if the event is in planning, is opened, or is closed; Open/ Closed/ Planning'
);
CREATE TABLE `Expense` (
  `expense_id` TEXT COMMENT 'unique id of income',
  `expense_description` TEXT COMMENT 'A textual description of what the money was spend for',
  `expense_date` TEXT COMMENT 'The date the expense was incurred; e.g. YYYY-MM-DD',
  `cost` DOUBLE COMMENT 'The dollar amount of the expense; the unit is dollar',
  `approved` TEXT COMMENT 'A true or false value indicating if the expense was approved; true/ false',
  `link_to_member` TEXT COMMENT 'The member who incurred the expense',
  `link_to_budget` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the record in the Budget table that indicates the expected total expenditure for a given category and event.; References the Budget table'
);
CREATE TABLE `Income` (
  `income_id` TEXT COMMENT 'A unique identifier for each record of income',
  `date_received` TEXT COMMENT 'the date that the fund received',
  `amount` BIGINT COMMENT 'amount of funds; the unit is dollar',
  `source` TEXT COMMENT 'A value indicating where the funds come from such as dues, or the annual university allocation',
  `notes` TEXT COMMENT 'A free-text value giving any needed details about the receipt of funds',
  `link_to_member` TEXT COMMENT 'link to member'
);
CREATE TABLE `Major` (
  `major_id` TEXT COMMENT 'A unique identifier for each major',
  `major_name` TEXT COMMENT 'major name',
  `department` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the department that offers the major',
  `college` TEXT COMMENT 'The name college that houses the department that offers the major'
);
CREATE TABLE `Member` (
  `member_id` TEXT COMMENT 'unique id of member',
  `first_name` TEXT COMMENT 'members first name',
  `last_name` TEXT COMMENT 'members last name; commonsense evidence: 
full name is first_name + last_name. e.g. A members first name is Angela and last name is Sanders. Thus, his/her full name is Angela Sanders.',
  `email` TEXT COMMENT 'members email',
  `position` TEXT COMMENT 'The position the member holds in the club',
  `t_shirt_size` TEXT COMMENT 'The size of tee shirt that member wants when shirts are ordered; commonsense evidence: usually the student ordered t-shirt with lager size has bigger body shape',
  `phone` TEXT COMMENT 'The best telephone at which to contact the member',
  `zip` BIGINT COMMENT 'the zip code of the members hometown',
  `link_to_major` TEXT COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the major of the member. References the Major table'
);
CREATE TABLE `Zip_Code` (
  `zip_code` BIGINT COMMENT 'The ZIP code itself. A five-digit number identifying a US post office.',
  `type` TEXT COMMENT 'The kind of ZIP code; commonsense evidence: 
� Standard: the normal codes with which most people are familiar 
� PO Box: zip codes have post office boxes 
� Unique: zip codes that are assigned to individual organizations.',
  `city` TEXT COMMENT 'The city to which the ZIP pertains',
  `county` TEXT COMMENT 'The county to which the ZIP pertains',
  `state` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the state to which the ZIP pertains',
  `short_state` TEXT COMMENT 'The abbreviation of the state to which the ZIP pertains'
);
chosen:
SELECT DISTINCT
  `T3`.`first_name`,
  `T3`.`last_name`,
  `T4`.`amount`
FROM `event` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `attendance` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`event_id` = `T2`.`link_to_event`
INNER JOIN `member` AS `T3`
  ON `T3`.`member_id` = `T2`.`link_to_member`
INNER JOIN `income` AS `T4`
  ON `T4`.`link_to_member` = `T3`.`member_id`
WHERE
  `T4`.`date_received` = '2019-09-09'
rejected:
SELECT
  `T2`.`first_name`,
  `T2`.`last_name`,
  `T1`.`amount`
FROM `income` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `member` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`link_to_member` = `T2`.`member_id`
WHERE
  `T1`.`date_received` = '2019-09-09'

FROM `Patient` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `Laboratory` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`ID` = `T2`.`ID`
WHERE
  `T1`.`Birthday` = '1959-02-18'
rejected:

  CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN DATE_FORMAT(`T2`.`Date`, '%m') = '12' THEN `T2`.`T-CHO` ELSE 0 END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / SUM(CASE WHEN DATE_FORMAT(`T2`.`Date`, '%m') = '11' THEN `T2`.`T-CHO` ELSE 0 END)
FROM `Patient` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `Laboratory` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`ID` = `T2`.`ID`
WHERE
  DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T1`.`Birthday` AS DATETIME), '%Y-%m-%d') = '1959-02-18' AND `T2`.`Date` LIKE '1981%'

  ON `T1`.`ID` = `T2`.`ID`
WHERE

  `T1`.`Diagnosis`
ORDER BY

LIMIT 1

  ON `T1`.`ID` = `T2`.`ID`

WHERE
  `T2`.`CPK` < 250

chosen:
SELECT  `t2`.`name` FROM `Match` AS `t1` INNER JOIN `League` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`league_id` = `t2`.`id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`season` = '2015/2016'
GROUP BY
  `t2`.`name`
ORDER BY
  SUM(`t1`.`home_team_goal` + `t1`.`away_team_goal`) DESC
LIMIT 1
rejected:
SELECT
  `t2`.`name`
FROM `Match` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `League` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`league_id` = `t2`.`id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`season` = '2015/2016'
GROUP BY
  `t2`.`name`
ORDER BY
  SUM(`t1`.`home_team_goal`) + SUM(`t1`.`away_team_goal`) DESC
LIMIT 1

chosen:
SELECT
  `teamInfo`.`team_long_name`
FROM `League` AS `leagueData`
INNER JOIN `Match` AS `matchData`
  ON `leagueData`.`id` = `matchData`.`league_id`
INNER JOIN `Team` AS `teamInfo`
  ON `matchData`.`away_team_api_id` = `teamInfo`.`team_api_id`
WHERE
  `leagueData`.`name` = 'Scotland Premier League'
  AND `matchData`.`season` = '2009/2010'
  AND `matchData`.`away_team_goal` - `matchData`.`home_team_goal` > 0
GROUP BY
  `matchData`.`away_team_api_id`
ORDER BY
  COUNT(*) DESC
LIMIT 1
rejected:
SELECT
  `t2`.`team_long_name`
FROM `Match` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Team` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`away_team_api_id` = `t2`.`team_api_id`
INNER JOIN `League` AS `t3`
  ON `t1`.`league_id` = `t3`.`id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`season` = '2009/2010' AND `t3`.`name` = 'Scottish Premier League' AND `t1`.`away_team_goal` > `t1`.`home_team_goal`
GROUP BY
  `t2`.`team_long_name`
ORDER BY
  COUNT(*) DESC
LIMIT 1

chosen:
SELECT
  `t2`.`name`
FROM `Match` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `League` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`league_id` = `t2`.`id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`season` = '2015/2016' AND `t1`.`home_team_goal` = `t1`.`away_team_goal`
GROUP BY
  `t2`.`name`
ORDER BY
  COUNT(`t1`.`id`) DESC
LIMIT 1

chosen: SELECT DISTINCT YEAR(CURDATE()) - YEAR(t2.birthday) AS age FROM Player_Attributes AS t1 INNER JOIN Player AS t2 ON t1.player_api_id = t2.player_api_id WHERE YEAR(t1.`date`) BETWEEN 2013 AND 2015 AND t1.sprint_speed >= 97

chosen:
SELECT
  `t2`.`name`,
  COUNT(`t1`.`id`)
FROM `Match` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `League` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`league_id` = `t2`.`id`
GROUP BY
  `t2`.`name`
ORDER BY
  COUNT(`t1`.`id`) DESC
LIMIT 1

  `t2`.`name`
ORDER BY
  COUNT(`t1`.`id`) DESC
LIMIT 1

chosen:
SELECT DISTINCT
  `t4`.`team_long_name`
FROM `Team_Attributes` AS `t3`
INNER JOIN `Team` AS `t4`
  ON `t3`.`team_api_id` = `t4`.`team_api_id`
WHERE
  SUBSTR(`t3`.`date`, 1, 4) = '2012'
  AND `t3`.`buildUpPlayPassing` > (
    SELECT
      CAST(SUM(`t2`.`buildUpPlayPassing`) AS DOUBLE) / COUNT(`t1`.`id`)
    FROM `Team` AS `t1`
    INNER JOIN `Team_Attributes` AS `t2`
      ON `t1`.`team_api_id` = `t2`.`team_api_id`
    WHERE
      DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`t2`.`date` AS DATETIME), '%Y') = '2012'
  )
rejected:
SELECT DISTINCT
  `t1`.`team_long_name`
FROM `Team` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Team_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`team_api_id` = `t2`.`team_api_id`
WHERE
  `t2`.`buildUpPlayPassing` > (
    SELECT
      AVG(`buildUpPlayPassing`)
    FROM `Team_Attributes`
    WHERE
      `date` LIKE '2012%'
  )

SELECT
  CAST(COUNT(CASE WHEN `t2`.`preferred_foot` = 'left' THEN `t1`.`id` ELSE NULL END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / COUNT(`t1`.`id`) AS `percent`
FROM `Player` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_api_id` = `t2`.`player_api_id`
WHERE

SELECT
  CAST(SUM(`t2`.`long_shots`) AS DOUBLE) / COUNT(`t2`.`date`)
FROM `Player` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_api_id` = `t2`.`player_api_id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`player_name` = 'Ahmed Samir Farag'

LIMIT 10

chosen:
SELECT
  `t1`.`name`
FROM `League` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Match` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`id` = `t2`.`league_id`
WHERE
  `t2`.`season` = '2009/2010'
GROUP BY
  `t1`.`name`
HAVING
  (
    CAST(SUM(`t2`.`home_team_goal`) AS DOUBLE) / COUNT(DISTINCT `t2`.`id`)
  ) - (
    CAST(SUM(`t2`.`away_team_goal`) AS DOUBLE) / COUNT(DISTINCT `t2`.`id`)
  ) > 0
rejected:
SELECT
  `t2`.`name`
FROM `Match` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `League` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`league_id` = `t2`.`id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`season` = '2009/2010'
GROUP BY
  `t2`.`name`
HAVING
  AVG(`t1`.`home_team_goal`) > AVG(`t1`.`away_team_goal`)

SELECT  `t2`.`overall_rating` FROM `Player` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_api_id` = `t2`.`player_api_id` WHERE  `t1`.`player_name` = 'Gabriel Tamas'  AND DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`t2`.`date` AS DATETIME), '%Y') = '2011'

WHERE
  SUBSTR(`t2`.`date`, 1, 4) = '2011' AND `t1`.`player_name` = 'Gabriel Tamas'

SELECT
  CAST(SUM(`t2`.`home_team_goal`) AS DOUBLE) / COUNT(`t2`.`id`)
FROM `Country` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Match` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`id` = `t2`.`country_id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`name` = 'Poland' AND `t2`.`season` = '2010/2011'

chosen: SELECT `A` FROM (SELECT AVG(`finishing`) AS `result`, 'Max' AS `A` FROM `Player` AS `T1` INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `T2` ON `T1`.`player_api_id` = `T2`.`player_api_id` WHERE `T1`.`height` = (SELECT MAX(`height`) FROM `Player`) UNION SELECT AVG(`finishing`) AS `result`, 'Min' AS `A` FROM `Player` AS `T1` INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `T2` ON `T1`.`player_api_id` = `T2`.`player_api_id` WHERE `T1`.`height` = (SELECT MIN(`height`) FROM `Player`)) AS `derived` ORDER BY `result` DESC LIMIT 1
rejected:
SELECT
  `t1`.`player_name`
FROM `Player` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_api_id` = `t2`.`player_api_id`
WHERE
  `t2`.`finishing` = (
    SELECT
      MAX(`finishing`)
    FROM `Player_Attributes`
  )
ORDER BY
  `t1`.`height` DESC
LIMIT 1

chosen:
SELECT
  CAST(SUM(`t2`.`overall_rating`) AS DOUBLE) / COUNT(`t2`.`id`)
FROM `Player` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_api_id` = `t2`.`player_api_id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`height` > 170
  AND DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`t2`.`date` AS DATETIME), '%Y') >= '2010'
  AND DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`t2`.`date` AS DATETIME), '%Y') <= '2015'
rejected:
SELECT

FROM `Player` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_api_id` = `t2`.`player_api_id`
WHERE
  DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`t2`.`date` AS DATETIME), '%Y') BETWEEN '2010' AND '2015'
  AND `t1`.`height` > 170

SELECT
  CAST(SUM(
    CASE WHEN `t1`.`player_name` = 'Abdou Diallo' THEN `t2`.`ball_control` ELSE 0 END
  ) AS DOUBLE) / COUNT(CASE WHEN `t1`.`player_name` = 'Abdou Diallo' THEN `t2`.`id` ELSE NULL END) - CAST(SUM(
    CASE
      WHEN `t1`.`player_name` = 'Aaron Appindangoye'
      THEN `t2`.`ball_control`
      ELSE 0
    END

FROM `Player` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `t2`

WHERE
  DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`t1`.`birthday` AS DATETIME), '%Y') < '1986'
  AND `t2`.`defensive_work_rate` = 'high'

  COUNT(`t2`.`id`)
FROM `League` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Match` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`id` = `t2`.`league_id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`name` = 'Belgium Jupiler League' AND SUBSTR(`t2`.`date`, 1, 7) = '2009-04'

chosen: SELECT `t1`.`name` FROM `League` AS `t1`JOIN `Match` AS `t2` ON `t1`.`id` = `t2`.`league_id` WHERE  `t2`.`season` = '2008/2009' GROUP BY  `t1`.`name` HAVING COUNT(`t2`.`id`) = (SELECT MAX(match_count) FROM (SELECT COUNT(`t2`.`id`) AS match_count FROM `Match` AS `t2` WHERE `t2`.`season` = '2008/2009' GROUP BY  `t2`.`league_id`) AS subquery)
rejected:
SELECT
  `t2`.`name`
FROM `Match` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `League` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`league_id` = `t2`.`id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`season` = '2008/2009'
GROUP BY
  `t2`.`name`
ORDER BY
  COUNT(`t1`.`id`) DESC
LIMIT 1

chosen:
SELECT
  (
    SUM(
      CASE
        WHEN `t1`.`player_name` = 'Ariel Borysiuk'
        THEN `t2`.`overall_rating`
        ELSE 0
      END
    ) * 1.0 - SUM(
      CASE WHEN `t1`.`player_name` = 'Paulin Puel' THEN `t2`.`overall_rating` ELSE 0 END
    )
  ) * 100 / SUM(
    CASE WHEN `t1`.`player_name` = 'Paulin Puel' THEN `t2`.`overall_rating` ELSE 0 END
  )
FROM `Player` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_api_id` = `t2`.`player_api_id`
rejected:
SELECT
  CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN `t1`.`player_name` = 'Ariel Borysiuk' THEN `t2`.`overall_rating` ELSE 0 END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / SUM(CASE WHEN `t1`.`player_name` = 'Paulin Puel' THEN `t2`.`overall_rating` ELSE 0 END)
FROM `Player` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_api_id` = `t2`.`player_api_id`

SELECT
  CAST(SUM(`t2`.`overall_rating`) AS DOUBLE) / COUNT(`t2`.`id`)
FROM `Player` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_api_id` = `t2`.`player_api_id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`player_name` = 'Pietro Marino'

CREATE TABLE `Team_Attributes` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique id for teams',

 Balanced: 34-66
 Fast: 66-100',

  `buildUpPlayPassing` BIGINT COMMENT 'affects passing distance and support from teammates',

 Mixed: 34-66
 Long: 66-100',
  `buildUpPlayPositioningClass` TEXT COMMENT 'A teams freedom of movement in the 1st two thirds of the pitch; Organised / Free Form',
  `chanceCreationPassing` BIGINT COMMENT 'Amount of risk in pass decision and run support',
  `chanceCreationPassingClass` TEXT COMMENT 'the chance creation passing class; commonsense reasoning: 
 Safe: 1-33
 Normal: 34-66
 Risky: 66-100',
  `chanceCreationCrossing` BIGINT COMMENT 'The tendency / frequency of crosses into the box',
  `chanceCreationCrossingClass` TEXT COMMENT 'the chance creation crossing class; commonsense reasoning: 
 Little: 1-33
 Normal: 34-66
 Lots: 66-100',
  `chanceCreationShooting` BIGINT COMMENT 'The tendency / frequency of shots taken',

 Little: 1-33
 Normal: 34-66
 Lots: 66-100',
  `chanceCreationPositioningClass` TEXT COMMENT 'A teams freedom of movement in the final third of the pitch; Organised / Free Form',
  `defencePressure` BIGINT COMMENT 'Affects how high up the pitch the team will start pressuring',
  `defencePressureClass` TEXT COMMENT 'the defence pressure class; commonsense reasoning: 
 Deep: 1-33
 Medium: 34-66
 High: 66-100',
  `defenceAggression` BIGINT COMMENT 'Affect the teams approach to tackling the ball possessor',
  `defenceAggressionClass` TEXT COMMENT 'the defence aggression class; commonsense reasoning: 
 Contain: 1-33
 Press: 34-66
 Double: 66-100',
  `defenceTeamWidth` BIGINT COMMENT 'Affects how much the team will shift to the ball side',
  `defenceTeamWidthClass` TEXT COMMENT 'the defence team width class; commonsense reasoning: 
 Narrow: 1-33
 Normal: 34-66
 Wide: 66-100',
  `defenceDefenderLineClass` TEXT COMMENT 'Affects the shape and strategy of the defence; Cover/ Offside Trap'
);
chosen:
SELECT
  `t2`.`chanceCreationPassing`,
  `t2`.`chanceCreationPassingClass`
FROM `Team` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Team_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`team_api_id` = `t2`.`team_api_id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`team_long_name` = 'Ajax'
ORDER BY
  `t2`.`chanceCreationPassing` DESC
LIMIT 1

  `t1`.`team_long_name` = 'Ajax'
ORDER BY
  `t2`.`chanceCreationPassing` DESC
LIMIT 1

SELECT

  ON `t1`.`team_api_id` = `t2`.`team_api_id`

WHERE
  `t1`.`team_long_name` = 'FC Lorient' AND DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`t2`.`date` AS DATETIME), '%Y-%m-%d') = '2010-02-22'

  CAST(SUM(`t2`.`overall_rating`) AS DOUBLE) / COUNT(`t2`.`id`)
FROM `Player` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_fifa_api_id` = `t2`.`player_fifa_api_id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`player_name` = 'Marko Arnautovic'
  AND SUBSTR(`t2`.`date`, 1, 10) BETWEEN '2007-02-22' AND '2016-04-21'

chosen:
SELECT
  (
    SUM(
      CASE
        WHEN `t1`.`player_name` = 'Landon Donovan'
        THEN `t2`.`overall_rating`
        ELSE 0
      END
    ) * 1.0 - SUM(
      CASE WHEN `t1`.`player_name` = 'Jordan Bowery' THEN `t2`.`overall_rating` ELSE 0 END
    )
  ) * 100 / SUM(
    CASE
      WHEN `t1`.`player_name` = 'Landon Donovan'
      THEN `t2`.`overall_rating`
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) AS `LvsJ_percent`
FROM `Player` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_fifa_api_id` = `t2`.`player_fifa_api_id`
WHERE
  SUBSTR(`t2`.`date`, 1, 10) = '2013-07-12'
rejected:
SELECT
  CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN `t2`.`player_name` = 'Landon Donovan' THEN `t1`.`overall_rating` ELSE 0 END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / SUM(CASE WHEN `t2`.`player_name` = 'Jordan Bowery' THEN `t1`.`overall_rating` ELSE 0 END)
FROM `Player_Attributes` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_api_id` = `t2`.`player_api_id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`date` = '2013-07-12 00:00:00'

chosen: SELECT player_name FROM (SELECT player_name, height, DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY height DESC) as `rank`FROM Player) AS ranked_players WHERE `rank` = 1
rejected:
SELECT DISTINCT
  `player_name`
FROM `Player`
ORDER BY
  `height` DESC
LIMIT 10

SELECT
  SUM(CASE WHEN `t1`.`id` = 6 THEN `t1`.`jumping` ELSE 0 END) - SUM(CASE WHEN `t1`.`id` = 23 THEN `t1`.`jumping` ELSE 0 END)
FROM `Player_Attributes` AS `t1`
rejected:
SELECT
  SUM(CASE WHEN `t1`.`player_api_id` = 6 THEN `t1`.`jumping` ELSE 0 END) - SUM(CASE WHEN `t1`.`player_api_id` = 23 THEN `t1`.`jumping` ELSE 0 END)
FROM `Player_Attributes` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_api_id` = `t2`.`player_api_id`

SELECT
  `t2`.`home_team_goal`,
  `t2`.`away_team_goal`
FROM `League` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Match` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`id` = `t2`.`league_id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`name` = 'Belgium Jupiler League' AND `t2`.`date` LIKE '2008-09-24%'
rejected:
SELECT
  `t1`.`home_team_goal`,
  `t1`.`away_team_goal`
FROM `Match` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `League` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`league_id` = `t2`.`id`
WHERE
  `t2`.`name` = 'Belgium Jupiler League' AND `t1`.`date` LIKE '2008-09-24%'

CREATE TABLE `Team_Attributes` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique id for teams',

  `defencePressure` BIGINT COMMENT 'Affects how high up the pitch the team will start pressuring',

 Deep: 1-33
 Medium: 34-66
 High: 66-100',
  `defenceAggression` BIGINT COMMENT 'Affect the teams approach to tackling the ball possessor',
  `defenceAggressionClass` TEXT COMMENT 'the defence aggression class; commonsense reasoning: 
 Contain: 1-33
 Press: 34-66
 Double: 66-100',
  `defenceTeamWidth` BIGINT COMMENT 'Affects how much the team will shift to the ball side',
  `defenceTeamWidthClass` TEXT COMMENT 'the defence team width class; commonsense reasoning: 
 Narrow: 1-33
 Normal: 34-66
 Wide: 66-100',
  `defenceDefenderLineClass` TEXT COMMENT 'Affects the shape and strategy of the defence; Cover/ Offside Trap'

chosen:
SELECT DISTINCT
  `t1`.`buildUpPlaySpeedClass`
FROM `Team_Attributes` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Team` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`team_api_id` = `t2`.`team_api_id`
WHERE
  `t2`.`team_long_name` = 'KSV Cercle Brugge'
rejected:
SELECT DISTINCT
  `t2`.`buildUpPlaySpeedClass`
FROM `Team` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Team_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`team_api_id` = `t2`.`team_api_id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`team_long_name` = 'KSV Cercle Brugge'

SELECT
  `id`,
  `finishing`,
  `curve`
FROM `Player_Attributes`
WHERE
  `player_api_id` = (
    SELECT
      `player_api_id`
    FROM `Player`
    ORDER BY
      `weight` DESC
    LIMIT 1
  )
LIMIT 1

  `t2`.`curve`

INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_api_id` = `t2`.`player_api_id`
ORDER BY
  `t1`.`weight` DESC
LIMIT 1

chosen:
SELECT
  `t1`.`name`
FROM `League` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Match` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`id` = `t2`.`league_id`
WHERE
  `t2`.`season` = '2015/2016'
GROUP BY
  `t1`.`name`
ORDER BY
  COUNT(`t2`.`id`) DESC
LIMIT 4
rejected:
SELECT
  `t2`.`name`
FROM `Match` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `League` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`league_id` = `t2`.`id`
WHERE
  `t1`.`season` = '2015/2016'
GROUP BY
  `t2`.`name`
ORDER BY
  COUNT(`t1`.`id`) DESC
LIMIT 4

SELECT DISTINCT
  `t1`.`player_name`
FROM `Player` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_api_id` = `t2`.`player_api_id`
WHERE
  `t2`.`overall_rating` = (
    SELECT
      MAX(`overall_rating`)
    FROM `Player_Attributes`
  )

WHERE
  `t2`.`overall_rating` = (
    SELECT
      MAX(`overall_rating`)
    FROM `Player_Attributes`
  )

SELECT
  CAST(COUNT(CASE WHEN `t2`.`overall_rating` > 70 AND `t1`.`height` < 180 THEN `t1`.`id` ELSE NULL END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / COUNT(`t1`.`id`) AS `percent`
FROM `Player` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_api_id` = `t2`.`player_api_id`
rejected:
SELECT
  CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN `t2`.`height` < 180 AND `t2`.`overall_rating` > 70 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / COUNT(`t2`.`id`)
FROM `Player` AS `t1`
INNER JOIN `Player_Attributes` AS `t2`
  ON `t1`.`player_api_id` = `t2`.`player_api_id`

);

);
CREATE TABLE `lapTimes` (

);

  `time` TEXT COMMENT 'time; exact time',
  `duration` TEXT COMMENT 'duration time; seconds/',

);
CREATE TABLE `qualifying` (
  `qualifyId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying qualifying; How does F1 Sprint qualifying work? Sprint qualifying is essentially a short-form Grand Prix  a race that is one-third the number of laps of the main event on Sunday. However, the drivers are battling for positions on the grid for the start of Sundays race.',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each race',
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each driver',
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'constructor Id',
  `number` BIGINT COMMENT 'number',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'position or track of circuit',
  `q1` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 1; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
Q1 lap times determine pole position and the order of the front 10 positions on the grid. The slowest driver in Q1 starts 10th, the next starts ninth and so on. 
All 20 F1 drivers participate in the first period, called Q1, with each trying to set the fastest time possible. Those in the top 15 move on to the next period of qualifying, called Q2. The five slowest drivers are eliminated and will start the race in the last five positions on the grid.',
  `q2` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 2; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
only top 15 in the q1 has the record of q2 
Q2 is slightly shorter but follows the same format. Drivers try to put down their best times to move on to Q1 as one of the 10 fastest cars. The five outside of the top 10 are eliminated and start the race from 11th to 15th based on their best lap time.',
  `q3` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 3; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
only top 10 in the q2 has the record of q3'
);
CREATE TABLE `races` (

  `circuitId` BIGINT COMMENT 'circuit Id',
  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'name of the race',
  `date` TEXT COMMENT 'duration time',
  `time` TEXT COMMENT 'time of the location',
  `url` TEXT COMMENT 'introduction of races'
);
CREATE TABLE `results` (
  `resultId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying race result',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying the race',
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying the driver',
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying which constructors',
  `number` BIGINT COMMENT 'number',
  `grid` BIGINT COMMENT 'the number identifying the area where cars are set into a grid formation in order to start the race.',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'The finishing position or track of circuits',
  `positionText` TEXT COMMENT 'not quite useful',
  `positionOrder` BIGINT COMMENT 'the finishing order of positions',
  `points` DOUBLE COMMENT 'points',
  `laps` BIGINT COMMENT 'lap number',
  `time` TEXT COMMENT 'finish time; commonsense evidence: 
1. if the value exists, it means the driver finished the race. 
2. Only the time of the champion shows in the format of "minutes: seconds.millionsecond", the time of the other drivers shows as "seconds.millionsecond" , which means their actual time is the time of the champion adding the value in this cell.',
  `milliseconds` BIGINT COMMENT 'the actual finishing time of drivers in milliseconds; the actual finishing time of drivers',
  `fastestLap` BIGINT COMMENT 'fastest lap number',
  `rank` BIGINT COMMENT 'starting rank positioned by fastest lap speed',
  `fastestLapTime` TEXT COMMENT 'fastest Lap Time; faster (smaller in the value) "fastestLapTime" leads to higher rank (smaller is higher rank)',
  `fastestLapSpeed` TEXT COMMENT 'fastest Lap Speed; (km / h)',
  `statusId` BIGINT COMMENT 'status ID; its category description appear in the table status'
);
CREATE TABLE `seasons` (
  `year` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying the race',
  `url` TEXT COMMENT 'website link of season race introduction'
);
CREATE TABLE `status` (
  `statusId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying status',
  `status` TEXT COMMENT 'full name of status'
);

SELECT
  `T2`.`driverRef`
FROM `qualifying` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`driverId` = `T1`.`driverId`
WHERE
  `T1`.`raceId` = 20
ORDER BY
  `T1`.`q1` DESC
LIMIT 5
rejected:
SELECT DISTINCT
  `T2`.`driverRef`
FROM `qualifying` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`driverId` = `T1`.`driverId`
WHERE
  `T1`.`raceId` = 20 AND `T1`.`q1` IS NULL

What is his number of the driver who finished 0:01:54 in the Q3 of qualifying race No.903?
CREATE TABLE `circuits` (
  `circuitId` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique identification number of the circuit',
  `circuitRef` TEXT COMMENT 'circuit reference name',
  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'full name of circuit',
  `location` TEXT COMMENT 'location of circuit',
  `country` TEXT COMMENT 'country of circuit',
  `lat` DOUBLE COMMENT 'latitude of location of circuit',
  `lng` DOUBLE COMMENT 'longitude of location of circuit; commonsense evidence: 
Location coordinates: (lat, lng)',
  `alt` BIGINT COMMENT 'not useful',
  `url` TEXT COMMENT 'url'
);
CREATE TABLE `constructorResults` (
  `constructorResultsId` BIGINT COMMENT 'constructor Results Id',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'race id',
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'constructor id',
  `points` DOUBLE COMMENT 'points',
  `status` TEXT COMMENT 'status'
);
CREATE TABLE `constructorStandings` (
  `constructorStandingsId` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique identification of the constructor standing records',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'id number identifying which races',
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'id number identifying which id',
  `points` TEXT COMMENT 'how many points acquired in each race',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'position or track of circuits',
  `positionText` TEXT COMMENT 'same with position, not quite useful',
  `wins` BIGINT COMMENT 'wins'
);
CREATE TABLE `constructors` (
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying constructors',
  `constructorRef` TEXT COMMENT 'Constructor Reference name',
  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'full name of the constructor',
  `nationality` TEXT COMMENT 'nationality of the constructor',
  `url` TEXT COMMENT 'the introduction website of the constructor; commonsense evidence: 
How to find out the detailed introduction of the constructor: through its url',
  `wins` BIGINT COMMENT 'wins'
);
CREATE TABLE `driverStandings` (
  `driverStandingsId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying driver standing records',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'id number identifying which races',
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'id number identifying which drivers',
  `points` DOUBLE COMMENT 'how many points acquired in each race',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'position or track of circuits',
  `positionText` TEXT COMMENT 'same with position, not quite useful',
  `wins` BIGINT COMMENT 'wins'
);
CREATE TABLE `drivers` (
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying each driver',
  `driverRef` TEXT COMMENT 'driver reference name',
  `number` BIGINT COMMENT 'number',
  `code` TEXT COMMENT 'abbreviated code for drivers; if "null" or empty, it means it doesnt have code',
  `forename` TEXT COMMENT 'forename',
  `surname` TEXT COMMENT 'surname',
  `dob` TEXT COMMENT 'date of birth',
  `nationality` TEXT COMMENT 'nationality of drivers',
  `url` TEXT COMMENT 'the introduction website of the drivers'
);
CREATE TABLE `lapTimes` (
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying race',
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each driver',
  `lap` BIGINT COMMENT 'lap number',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'position or track of circuits',
  `time` TEXT COMMENT 'lap time; in minutes / seconds / ...',
  `milliseconds` BIGINT COMMENT 'milliseconds'
);
CREATE TABLE `pitStops` (
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying race',
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each driver',
  `stop` BIGINT COMMENT 'stop number',
  `lap` BIGINT COMMENT 'lap number',
  `time` TEXT COMMENT 'time; exact time',
  `duration` TEXT COMMENT 'duration time; seconds/',
  `milliseconds` BIGINT COMMENT 'milliseconds'
);
CREATE TABLE `qualifying` (
  `qualifyId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying qualifying; How does F1 Sprint qualifying work? Sprint qualifying is essentially a short-form Grand Prix  a race that is one-third the number of laps of the main event on Sunday. However, the drivers are battling for positions on the grid for the start of Sundays race.',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each race',
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each driver',
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'constructor Id',
  `number` BIGINT COMMENT 'number',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'position or track of circuit',
  `q1` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 1; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
Q1 lap times determine pole position and the order of the front 10 positions on the grid. The slowest driver in Q1 starts 10th, the next starts ninth and so on. 
All 20 F1 drivers participate in the first period, called Q1, with each trying to set the fastest time possible. Those in the top 15 move on to the next period of qualifying, called Q2. The five slowest drivers are eliminated and will start the race in the last five positions on the grid.',
  `q2` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 2; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
only top 15 in the q1 has the record of q2 
Q2 is slightly shorter but follows the same format. Drivers try to put down their best times to move on to Q1 as one of the 10 fastest cars. The five outside of the top 10 are eliminated and start the race from 11th to 15th based on their best lap time.',
  `q3` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 3; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
only top 10 in the q2 has the record of q3'
);
CREATE TABLE `races` (
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying the race',
  `year` BIGINT COMMENT 'year',
  `round` BIGINT COMMENT 'round',
  `circuitId` BIGINT COMMENT 'circuit Id',
  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'name of the race',
  `date` TEXT COMMENT 'duration time',
  `time` TEXT COMMENT 'time of the location',
  `url` TEXT COMMENT 'introduction of races'
);
CREATE TABLE `results` (
  `resultId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying race result',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying the race',
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying the driver',
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying which constructors',
  `number` BIGINT COMMENT 'number',
  `grid` BIGINT COMMENT 'the number identifying the area where cars are set into a grid formation in order to start the race.',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'The finishing position or track of circuits',
  `positionText` TEXT COMMENT 'not quite useful',
  `positionOrder` BIGINT COMMENT 'the finishing order of positions',
  `points` DOUBLE COMMENT 'points',
  `laps` BIGINT COMMENT 'lap number',
  `time` TEXT COMMENT 'finish time; commonsense evidence: 
1. if the value exists, it means the driver finished the race. 
2. Only the time of the champion shows in the format of "minutes: seconds.millionsecond", the time of the other drivers shows as "seconds.millionsecond" , which means their actual time is the time of the champion adding the value in this cell.',
  `milliseconds` BIGINT COMMENT 'the actual finishing time of drivers in milliseconds; the actual finishing time of drivers',
  `fastestLap` BIGINT COMMENT 'fastest lap number',
  `rank` BIGINT COMMENT 'starting rank positioned by fastest lap speed',
  `fastestLapTime` TEXT COMMENT 'fastest Lap Time; faster (smaller in the value) "fastestLapTime" leads to higher rank (smaller is higher rank)',
  `fastestLapSpeed` TEXT COMMENT 'fastest Lap Speed; (km / h)',
  `statusId` BIGINT COMMENT 'status ID; its category description appear in the table status'
);
CREATE TABLE `seasons` (
  `year` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying the race',
  `url` TEXT COMMENT 'website link of season race introduction'
);
CREATE TABLE `status` (
  `statusId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying status',
  `status` TEXT COMMENT 'full name of status'
);
chosen:
SELECT
  `T2`.`number`
FROM `qualifying` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`driverId` = `T1`.`driverId`
WHERE
  `T1`.`raceId` = 903 AND `T1`.`q3` LIKE '1:54%'
rejected:
SELECT
  `T2`.`number`
FROM `qualifying` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`driverId` = `T1`.`driverId`
WHERE
  `T1`.`raceId` = 903 AND `T1`.`q3` = '1:54.000'

FROM `races` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `results` AS `T2`

commonsense evidence: 
Q1 lap times determine pole position and the order of the front 10 positions on the grid. The slowest driver in Q1 starts 10th, the next starts ninth and so on. 
All 20 F1 drivers participate in the first period, called Q1, with each trying to set the fastest time possible. Those in the top 15 move on to the next period of qualifying, called Q2. The five slowest drivers are eliminated and will start the race in the last five positions on the grid.',
  `q2` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 2; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
only top 15 in the q1 has the record of q2

WHERE
  `T1`.`raceId` = 161 AND `T1`.`time` = '1:27.000'

  ) * 100 / SUM(CASE WHEN `T2`.`raceId` = 853 THEN `T2`.`fastestLapSpeed` ELSE 0 END)
FROM `drivers` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `results` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`driverId` = `T1`.`driverId`
WHERE
  `T1`.`forename` = 'Paul' AND `T1`.`surname` = 'di Resta'

    ORDER BY
      `date` ASC
    LIMIT 1
  )
  AND DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`date` AS DATETIME), '%m') = (

    FROM `races`

    LIMIT 1
  )

commonsense evidence: 
Q1 lap times determine pole position and the order of the front 10 positions on the grid. The slowest driver in Q1 starts 10th, the next starts ninth and so on. 
All 20 F1 drivers participate in the first period, called Q1, with each trying to set the fastest time possible. Those in the top 15 move on to the next period of qualifying, called Q2. The five slowest drivers are eliminated and will start the race in the last five positions on the grid.',
  `q2` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 2; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
only top 15 in the q1 has the record of q2 
Q2 is slightly shorter but follows the same format. Drivers try to put down their best times to move on to Q1 as one of the 10 fastest cars. The five outside of the top 10 are eliminated and start the race from 11th to 15th based on their best lap time.',

  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying which constructors',
  `number` BIGINT COMMENT 'number',
  `grid` BIGINT COMMENT 'the number identifying the area where cars are set into a grid formation in order to start the race.',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'The finishing position or track of circuits',
  `positionText` TEXT COMMENT 'not quite useful',
  `positionOrder` BIGINT COMMENT 'the finishing order of positions',
  `points` DOUBLE COMMENT 'points',
  `laps` BIGINT COMMENT 'lap number',
  `time` TEXT COMMENT 'finish time; commonsense evidence: 
1. if the value exists, it means the driver finished the race. 
2. Only the time of the champion shows in the format of "minutes: seconds.millionsecond", the time of the other drivers shows as "seconds.millionsecond" , which means their actual time is the time of the champion adding the value in this cell.',
  `milliseconds` BIGINT COMMENT 'the actual finishing time of drivers in milliseconds; the actual finishing time of drivers',
  `fastestLap` BIGINT COMMENT 'fastest lap number',
  `rank` BIGINT COMMENT 'starting rank positioned by fastest lap speed',
  `fastestLapTime` TEXT COMMENT 'fastest Lap Time; faster (smaller in the value) "fastestLapTime" leads to higher rank (smaller is higher rank)',
  `fastestLapSpeed` TEXT COMMENT 'fastest Lap Speed; (km / h)',
  `statusId` BIGINT COMMENT 'status ID; its category description appear in the table status'
);

  `year` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying the race',

);
CREATE TABLE `status` (
  `statusId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying status',
  `status` TEXT COMMENT 'full name of status'
);
chosen:
SELECT
  `T3`.`forename`,
  `T3`.`surname`,
  `T2`.`points`
FROM `races` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `driverStandings` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`raceId` = `T1`.`raceId`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T3`
  ON `T3`.`driverId` = `T2`.`driverId`
ORDER BY
  `T2`.`points` DESC
LIMIT 1

  ON `T2`.`driverId` = `T1`.`driverId`
ORDER BY
  `T2`.`points` DESC
LIMIT 1

  AVG(`T2`.`milliseconds`)
FROM `races` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `lapTimes` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`raceId` = `T1`.`raceId`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T3`
  ON `T3`.`driverId` = `T2`.`driverId`
WHERE
  `T3`.`forename` = 'Lewis'
  AND `T3`.`surname` = 'Hamilton'
  AND `T1`.`year` = 2009
  AND `T1`.`name` = 'Malaysian Grand Prix'

chosen:
SELECT
  CAST(COUNT(CASE WHEN `T2`.`position` <> 1 THEN `T2`.`position` END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / COUNT(`T2`.`driverStandingsId`)
FROM `races` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `driverStandings` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`raceId` = `T1`.`raceId`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T3`
  ON `T3`.`driverId` = `T2`.`driverId`
WHERE
  `T3`.`surname` = 'Hamilton' AND `T1`.`year` >= 2010
rejected:
SELECT
  CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN `T2`.`position` = 1 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / COUNT(`T2`.`position`)
FROM `races` AS `T1`

  ON `T2`.`raceId` = `T1`.`raceId`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T3`
  ON `T3`.`driverId` = `T2`.`driverId`
WHERE
  `T3`.`forename` = 'Lewis' AND `T3`.`surname` = 'Hamilton' AND `T1`.`year` >= 2010

chosen:
SELECT
  `T1`.`forename`,
  `T1`.`surname`,
  `T1`.`nationality`,
  MAX(`T2`.`points`)
FROM `drivers` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `driverStandings` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`driverId` = `T1`.`driverId`
WHERE
  `T2`.`wins` >= 1
GROUP BY
  `T1`.`forename`,
  `T1`.`surname`,
  `T1`.`nationality`
ORDER BY
  COUNT(`T2`.`wins`) DESC
LIMIT 1

  DATE_FORMAT(CAST(CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AS DATETIME), '%Y') - DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`dob` AS DATETIME), '%Y'),

  `surname`

WHERE
  `nationality` = 'Japanese'
ORDER BY
  `dob` DESC
LIMIT 1

CREATE TABLE `qualifying` (
  `qualifyId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying qualifying; How does F1 Sprint qualifying work? Sprint qualifying is essentially a short-form Grand Prix  a race that is one-third the number of laps of the main event on Sunday. However, the drivers are battling for positions on the grid for the start of Sundays race.',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each race',
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each driver',
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'constructor Id',
  `number` BIGINT COMMENT 'number',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'position or track of circuit',
  `q1` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 1; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
Q1 lap times determine pole position and the order of the front 10 positions on the grid. The slowest driver in Q1 starts 10th, the next starts ninth and so on. 
All 20 F1 drivers participate in the first period, called Q1, with each trying to set the fastest time possible. Those in the top 15 move on to the next period of qualifying, called Q2. The five slowest drivers are eliminated and will start the race in the last five positions on the grid.',
  `q2` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 2; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
only top 15 in the q1 has the record of q2 
Q2 is slightly shorter but follows the same format. Drivers try to put down their best times to move on to Q1 as one of the 10 fastest cars. The five outside of the top 10 are eliminated and start the race from 11th to 15th based on their best lap time.',
  `q3` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 3; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
only top 10 in the q2 has the record of q3'

CREATE TABLE `results` (
  `resultId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying race result',

  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying the driver',
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying which constructors',
  `number` BIGINT COMMENT 'number',
  `grid` BIGINT COMMENT 'the number identifying the area where cars are set into a grid formation in order to start the race.',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'The finishing position or track of circuits',
  `positionText` TEXT COMMENT 'not quite useful',
  `positionOrder` BIGINT COMMENT 'the finishing order of positions',
  `points` DOUBLE COMMENT 'points',
  `laps` BIGINT COMMENT 'lap number',
  `time` TEXT COMMENT 'finish time; commonsense evidence: 
1. if the value exists, it means the driver finished the race. 
2. Only the time of the champion shows in the format of "minutes: seconds.millionsecond", the time of the other drivers shows as "seconds.millionsecond" , which means their actual time is the time of the champion adding the value in this cell.',

chosen:
SELECT DISTINCT
  `T2`.`name`,
  `T1`.`name`,
  `T1`.`location`
FROM `circuits` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `races` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`circuitID` = `T1`.`circuitId`
WHERE
  `T2`.`year` = 2005 AND DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T2`.`date` AS DATETIME), '%m') = '09'

  ON `T1`.`circuitID` = `T2`.`circuitId`
WHERE
  DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T1`.`date` AS DATETIME), '%Y-%m') = '2005-09'

SELECT
  CAST(COUNT(CASE WHEN `T1`.`country` = 'Germany' THEN `T2`.`circuitID` END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / COUNT(`T2`.`circuitId`)
FROM `circuits` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `races` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`circuitID` = `T1`.`circuitId`
WHERE
  `T2`.`name` = 'European Grand Prix'

FROM `races` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `circuits` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`circuitId` = `T2`.`circuitId`
WHERE
  `T1`.`name` = 'European Grand Prix'

SELECT
  `T3`.`forename`,
  `T3`.`surname`,
  `T3`.`driverRef`
FROM `races` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `results` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`raceId` = `T1`.`raceId`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T3`
  ON `T3`.`driverId` = `T2`.`driverId`
WHERE
  `T1`.`name` = 'Canadian Grand Prix' AND `T2`.`rank` = 1 AND `T1`.`year` = 2007
rejected:

  `T2`.`driverRef`
FROM `results` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`driverId` = `T2`.`driverId`
INNER JOIN `races` AS `T3`
  ON `T1`.`raceId` = `T3`.`raceId`
WHERE
  `T3`.`name` = 'Canadian Grand Prix' AND `T3`.`year` = 2007 AND `T1`.`rank` = 1

SELECT
  `name`
FROM `races`
WHERE
  `raceId` IN (
    SELECT
      `raceId`
    FROM `results`
    WHERE
      `rank` = 1
      AND `driverId` = (
        SELECT
          `driverId`
        FROM `drivers`
        WHERE
          `forename` = 'Lewis' AND `surname` = 'Hamilton'
      )
  )

WHERE
  `T1`.`driverId` = (
    SELECT
      `driverId`
    FROM `drivers`
    WHERE
      `forename` = 'Lewis' AND `surname` = 'Hamilton'
  )
ORDER BY
  `T1`.`position` ASC
LIMIT 1

  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying race',

);
CREATE TABLE `qualifying` (
  `qualifyId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying qualifying; How does F1 Sprint qualifying work? Sprint qualifying is essentially a short-form Grand Prix  a race that is one-third the number of laps of the main event on Sunday. However, the drivers are battling for positions on the grid for the start of Sundays race.',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each race',
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each driver',
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'constructor Id',
  `number` BIGINT COMMENT 'number',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'position or track of circuit',
  `q1` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 1; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
Q1 lap times determine pole position and the order of the front 10 positions on the grid. The slowest driver in Q1 starts 10th, the next starts ninth and so on. 
All 20 F1 drivers participate in the first period, called Q1, with each trying to set the fastest time possible. Those in the top 15 move on to the next period of qualifying, called Q2. The five slowest drivers are eliminated and will start the race in the last five positions on the grid.',
  `q2` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 2; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
only top 15 in the q1 has the record of q2 
Q2 is slightly shorter but follows the same format. Drivers try to put down their best times to move on to Q1 as one of the 10 fastest cars. The five outside of the top 10 are eliminated and start the race from 11th to 15th based on their best lap time.',
  `q3` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 3; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
only top 10 in the q2 has the record of q3'
);
CREATE TABLE `races` (
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying the race',
  `year` BIGINT COMMENT 'year',
  `round` BIGINT COMMENT 'round',
  `circuitId` BIGINT COMMENT 'circuit Id',
  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'name of the race',
  `date` TEXT COMMENT 'duration time',
  `time` TEXT COMMENT 'time of the location',
  `url` TEXT COMMENT 'introduction of races'
);
CREATE TABLE `results` (
  `resultId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying race result',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying the race',
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying the driver',
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying which constructors',
  `number` BIGINT COMMENT 'number',
  `grid` BIGINT COMMENT 'the number identifying the area where cars are set into a grid formation in order to start the race.',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'The finishing position or track of circuits',
  `positionText` TEXT COMMENT 'not quite useful',
  `positionOrder` BIGINT COMMENT 'the finishing order of positions',
  `points` DOUBLE COMMENT 'points',
  `laps` BIGINT COMMENT 'lap number',
  `time` TEXT COMMENT 'finish time; commonsense evidence: 
1. if the value exists, it means the driver finished the race. 
2. Only the time of the champion shows in the format of "minutes: seconds.millionsecond", the time of the other drivers shows as "seconds.millionsecond" , which means their actual time is the time of the champion adding the value in this cell.',
  `milliseconds` BIGINT COMMENT 'the actual finishing time of drivers in milliseconds; the actual finishing time of drivers',
  `fastestLap` BIGINT COMMENT 'fastest lap number',
  `rank` BIGINT COMMENT 'starting rank positioned by fastest lap speed',
  `fastestLapTime` TEXT COMMENT 'fastest Lap Time; faster (smaller in the value) "fastestLapTime" leads to higher rank (smaller is higher rank)',
  `fastestLapSpeed` TEXT COMMENT 'fastest Lap Speed; (km / h)',
  `statusId` BIGINT COMMENT 'status ID; its category description appear in the table status'
);
CREATE TABLE `seasons` (
  `year` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying the race',
  `url` TEXT COMMENT 'website link of season race introduction'
);
CREATE TABLE `status` (
  `statusId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying status',
  `status` TEXT COMMENT 'full name of status'
);
chosen:
SELECT
  `T2`.`fastestLapSpeed`
FROM `races` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `results` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`raceId` = `T1`.`raceId`
WHERE
  `T1`.`name` = 'Spanish Grand Prix'
  AND `T1`.`year` = 2009
  AND NOT `T2`.`fastestLapSpeed` IS NULL
ORDER BY
  `T2`.`fastestLapSpeed` DESC
LIMIT 1
rejected:

FROM `results` AS `T1`

  ON `T1`.`raceId` = `T2`.`raceId`
WHERE
  `T2`.`name` = 'Spanish Grand Prix' AND `T2`.`year` = 2009
ORDER BY
  `T1`.`fastestLapSpeed` DESC
LIMIT 1

chosen:
WITH `time_in_seconds` AS (
  SELECT
    `T1`.`positionOrder`,
    CASE
      WHEN `T1`.`positionOrder` = 1
      THEN (
        CAST(SUBSTR(`T1`.`time`, 1, 1) AS DOUBLE) * 3600
      ) + (
        CAST(SUBSTR(`T1`.`time`, 3, 2) AS DOUBLE) * 60
      ) + CAST(SUBSTR(`T1`.`time`, 6) AS DOUBLE)
      ELSE CAST(SUBSTR(`T1`.`time`, 2) AS DOUBLE)
    END AS `time_seconds`
  FROM `results` AS `T1`
  INNER JOIN `races` AS `T2`
    ON `T1`.`raceId` = `T2`.`raceId`
  WHERE
    `T2`.`name` = 'Australian Grand Prix'
    AND NOT `T1`.`time` IS NULL
    AND `T2`.`year` = 2008
), `champion_time` AS (
  SELECT
    `time_seconds`
  FROM `time_in_seconds`
  WHERE
    `positionOrder` = 1
), `last_driver_incremental` AS (
  SELECT
    `time_seconds`
  FROM `time_in_seconds`
  WHERE
    `positionOrder` = (
      SELECT
        MAX(`positionOrder`)
      FROM `time_in_seconds`
    )
)
SELECT
  (
    CAST((
      SELECT
        `time_seconds`
      FROM `last_driver_incremental`
    ) AS DOUBLE) * 100
  ) / (
    SELECT
      `time_seconds` + (
        SELECT
          `time_seconds`
        FROM `last_driver_incremental`
      )
    FROM `champion_time`
  )

INNER JOIN `results` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`raceId` = `T2`.`raceId`
WHERE
  `T1`.`name` = 'Australian Grand Prix' AND `T1`.`year` = 2008

GROUP BY

  COUNT(`raceId`) = 2

  CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN NOT `T1`.`time` IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / COUNT(`T1`.`raceId`)
FROM `results` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `races` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`raceId` = `T2`.`raceId`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T3`
  ON `T1`.`driverId` = `T3`.`driverId`
WHERE
  `T3`.`nationality` = 'Japanese' AND `T2`.`year` BETWEEN 2007 AND 2009

FROM `drivers` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `results` AS `T2`
  ON `T2`.`driverId` = `T1`.`driverId`
INNER JOIN `races` AS `T3`
  ON `T3`.`raceId` = `T2`.`raceId`
WHERE
  `T1`.`nationality` = 'Japanese' AND `T3`.`year` BETWEEN 2007 AND 2009

However, the drivers are battling for positions on the grid for the start of Sundays race.',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each race',

Q1 lap times determine pole position and the order of the front 10 positions on the grid. The slowest driver in Q1 starts 10th, the next starts ninth and so on. 
All 20 F1 drivers participate in the first period, called Q1, with each trying to set the fastest time possible. Those in the top 15 move on to the next period of qualifying, called Q2. The five slowest drivers are eliminated and will start the race in the last five positions on the grid.',
  `q2` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 2; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
only top 15 in the q1 has the record of q2 
Q2 is slightly shorter but follows the same format. Drivers try to put down their best times to move on to Q1 as one of the 10 fastest cars. The five outside of the top 10 are eliminated and start the race from 11th to 15th based on their best lap time.',
  `q3` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 3; in minutes / seconds / ...

only top 10 in the q2 has the record of q3'

  `points` DOUBLE COMMENT 'points',
  `laps` BIGINT COMMENT 'lap number',
  `time` TEXT COMMENT 'finish time; commonsense evidence: 
1. if the value exists, it means the driver finished the race. 
2. Only the time of the champion shows in the format of "minutes: seconds.millionsecond", the time of the other drivers shows as "seconds.millionsecond" , which means their actual time is the time of the champion adding the value in this cell.',

);
chosen: WITH time_in_seconds AS (SELECT T2.year, T2.raceId, T1.positionOrder, CASE WHEN T1.positionOrder = 1 THEN (CAST(SUBSTR(T1.time, 1, 1) AS FLOAT) * 3600) + (CAST(SUBSTR(T1.time, 3, 2) AS FLOAT) * 60) + CAST(SUBSTR(T1.time, 6, 2) AS FLOAT) + CAST(SUBSTR(T1.time, 9) AS FLOAT) / 1000 ELSE 0 END AS time_seconds FROM results AS T1 INNER JOIN races AS T2 ON T1.raceId = T2.raceId WHERE NOT T1.time IS NULL), champion_time AS (SELECT year, raceId, time_seconds FROM time_in_seconds WHERE positionOrder = 1) SELECT year, AVG(time_seconds) FROM champion_time WHERE year < 1975 GROUP BY year HAVING NOT AVG(time_seconds) IS NULL
rejected:
SELECT
  CAST(SUBSTR(`T1`.`time`, 1, 2) AS DOUBLE) * 60 + CAST(SUBSTR(`T1`.`time`, 4, 2) AS DOUBLE) + CAST(SUBSTR(`T1`.`time`, 7, 3) AS DOUBLE) / 1000 AS `avg_time`
FROM `results` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `races` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`raceId` = `T2`.`raceId`
WHERE
  `T1`.`time` IS NOT NULL AND `T2`.`year` < 1975 AND `T1`.`position` = 1
GROUP BY
  `T2`.`year`

chosen:
SELECT
  CAST(SUM(
    CASE
      WHEN DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T3`.`dob` AS DATETIME), '%Y') < '1985' AND `T1`.`laps` > 50
      THEN 1
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / COUNT(*)
FROM `results` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `races` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`raceId` = `T2`.`raceId`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T3`
  ON `T1`.`driverId` = `T3`.`driverId`
WHERE
  `T2`.`year` BETWEEN 2000 AND 2005
rejected:
SELECT
  CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN NOT (`T2`.`laps` IS NULL) AND `T2`.`laps` > 50 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / COUNT(`T1`.`driverId`)
FROM `drivers` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `results` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`driverId` = `T2`.`driverId`
INNER JOIN `races` AS `T3`
  ON `T2`.`raceId` = `T3`.`raceId`
WHERE
  DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T1`.`dob` AS DATETIME), '%Y') < '1985' AND `T3`.`year` BETWEEN 2000 AND 2005

SELECT
  COUNT(`T1`.`driverId`)
FROM `drivers` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `lapTimes` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`driverId` = `T2`.`driverId`
WHERE
  `T1`.`nationality` = 'French'
  AND (
    CAST(SUBSTR(`T2`.`time`, 1, 2) AS SIGNED) * 60 + CAST(SUBSTR(`T2`.`time`, 4, 2) AS SIGNED) + CAST(SUBSTR(`T2`.`time`, 7, 2) AS DOUBLE) / 1000
  ) < 120

WHERE
  `T1`.`nationality` = 'French' AND `T2`.`time` < '02:00.00'

chosen:
SELECT
  `T2`.`driverId`,
  `T2`.`code`
FROM `results` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`driverId` = `T2`.`driverId`
WHERE
  DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T2`.`dob` AS DATETIME), '%Y') = '1971'
  AND NOT `T1`.`fastestLapTime` IS NULL
rejected:
SELECT DISTINCT
  `T1`.`driverId`,
  `T1`.`code`
FROM `drivers` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `results` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`driverId` = `T2`.`driverId`
WHERE
  DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T1`.`dob` AS DATETIME), '%Y') = '1971' AND NOT `T2`.`fastestLapTime` IS NULL

chosen:
SELECT
  `T3`.`year`,
  `T3`.`name`,
  `T3`.`date`,
  `T3`.`time`
FROM `qualifying` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`driverId` = `T2`.`driverId`
INNER JOIN `races` AS `T3`
  ON `T1`.`raceId` = `T3`.`raceId`
WHERE
  `T1`.`driverId` = (
    SELECT
      `driverId`
    FROM `drivers`
    ORDER BY
      `dob` DESC
    LIMIT 1
  )
ORDER BY
  `T3`.`date` ASC
LIMIT 1
rejected:
SELECT DISTINCT
  `T1`.`year`,
  `T2`.`name`,
  `T2`.`date`,
  `T2`.`time`
FROM `races` AS `T2`
INNER JOIN `qualifying` AS `T1`
  ON `T1`.`raceId` = `T2`.`raceId`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T3`
  ON `T3`.`driverId` = `T1`.`driverId`
WHERE
  `T1`.`q1` IS NOT NULL AND `T1`.`q2` IS NOT NULL AND `T1`.`q3` IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY
  `T3`.`dob` DESC
LIMIT 1

  AND DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T2`.`dob` AS DATETIME), '%Y') BETWEEN '1980' AND '1985'

  AVG(`T1`.`duration`)

  `T2`.`nationality` = 'German' AND DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T2`.`dob` AS DATETIME), '%Y') BETWEEN '1980' AND '1985'
GROUP BY
  `T2`.`forename`,
  `T2`.`surname`
ORDER BY
  AVG(CAST(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(`T1`.`duration`, ' ', ''), 'M', ''), 'S', '') AS DOUBLE)) ASC
LIMIT 3

  `qualifyId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying qualifying; How does F1 Sprint qualifying work? However, the drivers are battling for positions on the grid for the start of Sundays race.',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each race',
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each driver',
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'constructor Id',
  `number` BIGINT COMMENT 'number',

commonsense evidence: 
Q1 lap times determine pole position and the order of the front 10 positions on the grid. The slowest driver in Q1 starts 10th, the next starts ninth and so on. 
All 20 F1 drivers participate in the first period, called Q1, with each trying to set the fastest time possible. Those in the top 15 move on to the next period of qualifying, called Q2. The five slowest drivers are eliminated and will start the race in the last five positions on the grid.',
  `q2` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 2; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
only top 15 in the q1 has the record of q2

  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying which constructors',
  `number` BIGINT COMMENT 'number',
